critique: This document is an executive order that exempts John S. Patterson from mandatory retirement. It is difficult to assess the ideological tilt, immigration approach, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, and social inclusion based on this document alone, as it primarily deals with personnel matters. However, the decision to exempt someone from mandatory retirement could be seen as an expansion of executive power, although a minor one. Therefore, most scores will be neutral, with a slight positive score for executive power.
